message_1: How many elements are in the set A = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9} if we remove the elements in the set B = {2, 4, 6, 8}?
message_2:
To find the number of elements in set A after removing the elements in set B, we can simply subtract the number of elements in set B from the number of elements in set A.

Set A has 9 elements, and set B has 4 elements. So after removing the elements in set B from set A, we have:

9 - 4 = 5 elements

So, there are 5 elements in set A after removing the elements in set B.
